results.title: Tuning up for life
results.creator_credit: Teleproduction Zurich, Reni Mertens and Walter Marti
results.brief_description: A class of young children from the Institute of Rhythmics, Zurich, at work under the direction of Mimi Scheiblauer, who built the Institute on the principles of Calcroze’s eurhythmics. Children’s natural urge to move around and make a noise is guided by music and used to develop qualities of control and attention. Miss Scheiblauer discusses some of the principles involved.

results.title: Tuned percussion
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Milton Ingerson
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Basic Music Techniques”
One of a series of films designed to assist the musician and the music lover. Professional musicians show how each instrument of the percussion group is played, demonstrate their range and tone, and show how to care for these instruments.

results.title: Tunarama
results.creator_credit: South Australian Government Tourist Bureau and Geoffrey Shepherd
results.brief_description: Features Port Lincoln, home of Australia’s largest tuna fleet. Shows a procession of floats; a beauty parade; blessing of the boats; “Tunarama” which celebrates the opening of the tuna season; the wild and natural scenery of the Eyre Peninsula; motels; the Port at play and at work; large granaries; tuna canning factory and loading of the merchant ships. Narrated by Eldon Crouch.

results.title: Tumbling and floor exercises
results.creator_credit: Associated Film Services and Jan Sadlo
results.brief_description: Demonstrates proper techniques in various tumbling and floor exercise skills. The moves are then shown together as a series of movements to emphasise proper composition of routines. From basic to intermediate difficulty.

results.title: Tumbledown farm. Part 2
results.brief_description: Further adventures of Georgina who comes to stay with her grandfather, Farmer Dick on Tumbledown Farm. In these episodes the Chickabiddies announce the arrival of the ten new chicks; the tractors, Hubert and Fred decide which are the cleverest animals; Farmer Dick tells the story of Dulcie Maud and her 106 kittens while Georgina finds out about Prince Charming and who went riding in the baker’s van. These episodes are a charming blend of animation, puppetry and real life. Based on the stories of Dick King-Smith.

results.title: Tumbledown farm. Part 1
results.brief_description: Georgina comes to stay with her grandfather Farmer Dick on Tumbledown Farm. She makes friends with a variety of puppet characters and animals, including the Chickabiddies (singing hens), Hubert and Fred (farm machinery) and her friend the cat. In these three episodes Georgina discovers who is the cleverest animal; Farmer Dick tells how he flew in the story of Barney the Bull and Georgina discovers which comes first - the horse or the cart. This video is an enchanting, entertaining blend of animation, puppetry and real life. Based on the stories of Dick King-Smith.

results.title: Tumanu's people
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Frank Bagnall and John Morris
results.brief_description: Documents Commonwealth Government assistance to the Aboriginal people of the Northern Territory in 1960. Shows the contrast between the old aboriginal way of life, which is gone for ever and the new. Stresses the progress made over recent years, the difficulties of older people adjusting to big changes and how the children will be those to enjoy the new life.

results.title: Tullamarine: Melbourne airport
results.creator_credit: AVEC Film, Ivan Gaal and Ross Campbell
results.brief_description: About the operational and sociological role of a modern airport in the life of people who pass through it and work in it. Follows the arrival of Qantas flight QF2 and departure QF1. Non-narrated.
